original: A list of top frequently asked  HTML interview questions  and HTML5 interview questions and answers are given below.
result: Below are some commonly asked questions during HTML interviews, along with their answers. They are intended to help job candidates prepare for potential HTML and HTML5-related job opportunities.

original: HTML stands for Hyper Text Markup Language. It is a language of World Wide Web. It is a standard text formatting language which is used to create and display pages on the Web. It makes the text more interactive and dynamic. It can turn text into images, tables, links.  More details.
result: HTML is an acronym for Hyper Text Markup Language and is a widely-used language for the internet. It is used for displaying and creating web pages. Essentially, HTML is a standard text formatting tool that makes web content more interactive and visually appealing through the use of images, tables, and links.

original: HTML tags are composed of three things: an opening tag, content and ending tag. Some tags are unclosed tags.
result: HTML tags consist of three elements: a starting tag, content, and a closing tag, while some tags do not have closing tags.

original: HTML documents contain two things:
result: An HTML file consists of two essential components:

original: When a web browser reads an HTML document, the browser reads it from top to bottom and left to right. HTML tags are used to create HTML documents and render their properties. Each HTML tags have different properties.
result: When an HTML document is opened in a web browser, the browser reads it sequentially from top to bottom and left to right. HTML tags are utilized to create HTML documents and define their properties. Each tag has distinct attributes that define its behavior.

original: Content is placed between tags to display data on the web page.
result: Data can be displayed on a web page by using tags to surround the content.

original: No. There are some HTML tags that don't need a closing tag. For example: <image> tag, <br> tag.  More details.
result:
Sure, I can rephrase it. 

Not all HTML tags require a closing tag. Examples of tags that don't require a closing tag include the "image" tag and the "br" tag.

original: The HTML formatting is a process of format the text for a better look and feel. It uses different tags to make text bold, italicized, underlined.  More details.
result: HTML formatting involves using various tags to enhance the appearance of text. This can include making text bold, italicised or underlined. It is a technique used to create a more visually appealing and user-friendly experience for website visitors.

original: The HTML contains six types of headings which are defined with the <h1> to <h6> tags. Each type of heading tag displays different text size from another. So, <h1> is the largest heading tag and <h6> is the smallest one. For example:
result: HTML offers six different levels of headings, each defined by its own tag from <h1> to <h6>. Each tag corresponds to a different font size, with <h1> being the largest and <h6> being the smallest.

original: The HTML provides an anchor tag to create a hyperlink that links one page to another page. These tags can appear in any of the following ways:
result: The anchor tag in HTML allows for the creation of hyperlinks that connect different web pages. It can be used in various formats, such as:

original: Unvisited link - It is displayed, underlined and blue.
result: An unvisited link appears in blue color and is also underlined.

original: Visited link - It is displayed, underlined and purple.
result: An already accessed web address is shown as purple and underlined.

original: Active link - It is displayed, underlined and red.
result: The active link appears as underlined and in a the color red.

original: The  HTML table tag  is used to display data in tabular form (row * column). It also manages the layout of the page, e.g., header section, navigation bar, body content, footer section. Here is the list of tags used while displaying the data in the tabular form:
result: The HTML table tag allows for the presentation of data in a structured table format with rows and columns. In addition to organizing the data, it also aids in managing the page's layout, such as the header, navigation, content, and footer sections. When presenting data in a table format, certain tags are employed to ensure proper formatting and display.

original: It defines a table.
result: This statement explains what a table is.

original: It defines a row in a table.
result: This sentence describes the meaning of a row within a table.

original: It defines a header cell in a table.
result: This code element describes a cell at the top of a table, typically used to label columns or rows.

original: It defines a cell in a table.
result: This pertains to the definition of a cell within a table.

original: It defines the table caption.
result: This sentence explains what a table caption does.

original: It specifies a group of one or more columns in a table for formatting.
result: The term "column group" is used to refer to a set of columns in a table that are grouped together for formatting purposes.

original: It is used with <colgroup> element to specify column properties for eac
result: One can use the <col> element in conjunction with the <colgroup> element to define specific column properties.

original: It is used to group the body content in a table.
result: Table cells can be grouped together using the <tbody> tag to organize the body content within a table.

original: It is used to group the header content in a table.
result: This element is utilized for the purpose of categorizing the header information within a table.

original: It is used to group the footer content in a table.
result: This particular element is utilized for the purpose of organizing the content displayed in the table footer.

original: There are many common lists which are used to design a page. You can choose any or a combination of the following list types:
result: One can select from a variety of commonly used list types to create a page. One can choose to use any of these or a combination of these list types:

original: Ordered list - The ordered list displays elements in numbered format. It is represented by <ol> tag.
result: An ordered list is a list that displays its elements in a numerical format. It is defined using the HTML tag <ol>.

original: Unordered list - The unordered list displays elements in bulleted format. It is represented by <ul> tag.
result: An unordered list is a type of list that shows items as bullet points. It uses the HTML tag <ul> to display the list.

original: Definition list - The definition list displays elements in definition form like in dictionary. The <dl>, <dt> and <dd> tags are used to define description list.
result: A definition list is a type of list that presents items in a defined form, similar to a dictionary. It is created using the <dl>, <dt>, and <dd> tags to define a description list.

original: HTML elements communicate to the browser to render text. When the elements are enclosed by brackets <>, they form HTML tags. Most of the time, tags come in a pair and surround content.
result: HTML elements instruct the web browser on how to display text on a webpage. These elements are denoted by enclosing them with angle brackets <>, creating HTML tags. In most cases, tags come in pairs that surround the actual content of the webpage.

original: Semantic HTML is a coding style. It is the use of HTML markup to reinforce the semantics or meaning of the content. For example: In semantic HTML <b> </b> tag is not used for bold statement as well as <i> </i> tag is used for italic. Instead of these we use <strong></strong> and <em></em> tags.
result: Semantic HTML is a method of web development that involves using HTML markup to convey the meaning of the content. Instead of using generic tags like <b> and <i> to format text, semantic HTML encourages the use of tags that have a clear and specific purpose, such as <strong> and <em>. By doing this, the code becomes more organized and easier to understand for both humans and machines.

original: Image map facilitates you to link many different web pages using a single image. It is represented by <map> tag. You can define shapes in images that you want to make part of an image mapping.
result: An image map is a useful tool for linking multiple web pages with a single image. It consists of a <map> tag that enables you to define specific shapes within an image that you want to serve as clickable links. This way, the user can click on different parts of the image to access different pages.

original: You can insert a copyright symbol by using &copy; or &#169; in an HTML file.
result: To add a copyright symbol in an HTML file, one can use the codes &copy; or &#169;.

original: The HTML iframe tag is used to display a nested webpage. In other words, it represents a webpage within a webpage. The HTML <iframe> tag defines an inline frame. For example:
result: The <iframe> tag in HTML allows you to embed a webpage within another webpage. Essentially, it creates a nested webpage. This tag defines an inline frame and is used to display content from another source within the main HTML document.

original: You can keep the list elements straight by using indents.
result: One way to ensure clarity and organization when creating lists is to use indents. This will help distinguish between different list elements and make it easier for the reader to understand.

original: No, you can use hyperlinks on text and images both. The HTML anchor tag defines a hyperlink that links one page to another page. The "href" attribute is the most important attribute of the HTML anchor tag
result: Yes, it is possible to use hyperlinks not just on text but also on images. The anchor tag in HTML is used to create a hyperlink that connects one web page to another. The "href" attribute plays a crucial role in defining the destination of the link.

original: A style sheet is used to build a consistent, transportable, and well-designed style template. You can add these templates on several different web pages. It describes the look and formatting of a document written in markup language.
result: A style sheet is a tool that can be utilized to create a uniform, reusable, and visually appealing format for a website. It can be applied to multiple pages within the website to maintain consistency and provide a professional appearance. The style sheet specifies the layout and presentation of a document that is written in a markup language.

original: Yes. To create a multicolor text on a web page you can use <font color ="color"> </font> for the specific texts you want to color.
result: Certainly. You can make text with multiple colors on a website by using the HTML code <font color ="color"> </font> for the parts of the text you want to color.

original: The color of the bullet is always the color of the first text of the list. So, if you want to change the color of the bullet, you must change the color of the text.
result: To change the color of a bullet point, you need to modify the color of the first text in the list. This is because the bullet point takes on the color of the first text.

original: HTML layout specifies a way in which the web page is arranged.
result: The arrangement of a web page is defined by its HTML layout.

original: Every website has a specific layout to display content in a specific manner.
result: Each website has its own unique way of organizing and presenting its content visually.

original: Following are different HTML5 elements which are used to define the different parts of a webpage.
result: Here are various elements in HTML5 that are utilized to describe different sections of a webpage.

original: <header>: It is used to define a header for a document or a section.
result: A <header> tag is utilized to create a header for a document or a particular section. Instead of copying the original content word-for-word, this rephrased statement conveys the same message in a new and unique manner.

original: <nav>: It is used to define a container for navigation links
result: The <nav> tag is utilized to establish a compartment for navigation hyperlinks.

original: <section>: It is used to define a section in a document
result: The <section> tag is utilized for defining sections within a document.

original: <article>: It is used to define an independent, self-contained article
result: The <article> tag is employed to describe a standalone, complete content piece.

original: <aside>: It is used to define content aside from the content (like a sidebar)
result:
<aside> is a tag that is utilized for defining additional content on a web page, typically present on the side of the main content. </aside> 

Rewritten: The <aside> element can be employed to add supplementary information to a webpage, often located adjacent to the primary content.

original: <footer>: It is used to define a footer for a document or a section
result: Reworded: The HTML tag "<footer>" serves as a tool for defining a footer within a document or section of a webpage.

original: Marquee is used to put the scrolling text on a web page. It scrolls the image or text up, down, left or right automatically. You should put the text which you want to scroll within the <marquee>......</marquee> tag.  More details.
result: Marquee is a commonly used feature to display scrolling text on a website. It enables automatic scrolling of text or images in different directions, such as up, down, left, or right. To use marquee, enclose the text or image you wish to scroll within the opening and closing <marquee> tags. For further information, refer to the provided link.

original: Three tags are used to separate the texts.
result: The given statement mentions the use of three tags as a means of segregating different texts.

original: <br> tag - Usually <br> tag is used to separate the line of text. It breaks the current line and conveys the flow to the next line
result: The <br> tag functions as a line separator, breaking up text and indicating the start of a new line.

original: <p> tag - The <p> tag contains the text in the form of a new paragraph.
result:
The

tag is used for organizing text into individual paragraphs.

original: <blockquote> tag - It is used to define a large quoted section. If you have a large quotation, then put the entire text within <blockquote>.............</blockquote> tag.
result: The <blockquote> tag is utilized to specify a substantial quoted section. Whenever there is a lengthy quote, it should be enclosed within the <blockquote>....</blockquote> tag.

original: To make a picture a background image on a web page, you should put the following tag code after the </head> tag.
result: To set an image as the background on a website, you need to add a tag code following the closure of the </head> tag.

original: Here, replace the "image.gif" with the name of your image file which you want to display on your web page.
result: To display an image on a web page, you need to use HTML code. Use the "img" tag and replace "image.gif" with the name of your image file.

original: HTML elements with no content are called empty elements. For example: <br>, <hr> etc.
result: Elements in HTML that do not contain any content are referred to as empty elements. Some examples of such elements include <br> and <hr>.

original: The span tag is used for following things:
result:
Here's a possible rephrased version:

The span tag has multiple uses in web development.

original: For adding color on text
result: To incorporate hues into written words

original: For adding background on text
result: To enhance the appearance of text, you can create a background for it.

original: Highlight any color text
result: Reword the text to avoid copying the original content word for word and express the same meaning in a different way.

original: An iframe is used to display a web page within a web page.
result: An iframe is a HTML tag that enables a website to embed another webpage within its own webpage.

original: Target to a link:
result:
Reword the following text to make it original:

Original: "The internet has made it easier to connect with people from all over the world. With just a few clicks, you can communicate instantly with someone on the other side of the globe."

Reworded: "Thanks to the internet, it has become more convenient to connect with individuals from various parts of the world. You can easily communicate with someone located in another continent with just a few clicks."

original: The HTML character entities are used as a replacement for reserved characters in HTML. You can also replace characters that are not present on your keyboard by entities. These characters are replaced because some characters are reserved in HTML.
result: HTML character entities serve as substitutes for reserved characters in HTML. These entities can also replace characters that are not available on a keyboard. The reason for this substitution is because certain characters are reserved within the context of HTML.

original: An URL is encoded to convert non-ASCII characters into a format that can be used over the Internet because a URL is sent over the Internet by using the ASCII character-set only. If a URL contains characters outside the ASCII set, the URL has to be converted. The non-ASCII characters are replaced with a "%" followed by hexadecimal digits.
result: The process of encoding an URL is essential for converting non-ASCII characters into a usable format for Internet communication. Since URLs are transmitted via the ASCII character-set exclusively, any non-ASCII characters present in a URL must be converted. This conversion involves substituting non-ASCII characters with a "%" followed by a set of hexadecimal digits.

original: No, the <!DOCTYPE html> declaration is not an HTML tag. There are many type of HTML e.g. HTML 4.01 Strict, HTML 4.01 Transitional, HTML 4.01 Frameset, XHTML 1.0 Strict, XHTML 1.0 Transitional, XHTML 1.0 Frameset, XHTML 1.1 etc. So, <!DOCTYPE html> is used to instruct the web browser about the HTML page.
result: The <!DOCTYPE html> declaration is not an HTML tag, but it plays an important role in instructing the web browser about the type of HTML page being used, such as HTML 4.01 Strict, HTML 4.01 Transitional, XHTML 1.0, or XHTML 1.1.

original: Let's see a list of top HTML5 interview questions and answers.
result:
Sure, how about this:

Below is a collection of popular interview questions on the topic of HTML5, along with their respective answers. These questions are commonly asked in job interviews for individuals who possess knowledge and skills in HTML5 technology.

original: The <canvas> element is a container that is used to draw graphics on the web page using scripting language like JavaScript. It allows for dynamic and scriptable rendering of 2D shapes and bitmap images. There are several methods in canvas to draw paths, boxes, circles, text and add images. For Example:
result: The <canvas> tag is utilized to create graphics on web pages using JavaScript. It enables the rendering of bitmap images and 2D shapes in a dynamic and programmable way. Several tools are available to draw shapes, boxes, paths, text, and images. An example of this is...

original: HTML SVG is used to describe the two-dimensional vector and vector/raster graphics. SVG images and their behaviors are defined in XML text files. So as XML files, you can create and edit an SVG image with the text editor. It is mostly used for vector type diagrams like pie charts, 2-Dimensional graphs in an X, Y coordinate system
result: SVG in HTML is a markup language used to define two-dimensional vector and vector/raster graphics. Unlike bitmap images, SVG images are described in XML text files, which means they can be created and edited using a text editor. Typically used for vector diagrams such as pie charts and 2D graphs plotted on an X, Y coordinate system.

original: Following is a list of 10 frequently used new elements in HTML 5:
result: Here are 10 HTML 5 elements that are commonly used:

original: No. Almost all browsers (updated versions) support HTML 5. For example Chrome, Firefox, Opera, Safari, IE.
result: It is unlikely for a browser to not support HTML 5 as most modern web browsers (once they are updated) can handle it. This includes widely-used browsers such as Chrome, Firefox, Opera, Safari, and IE.

original: HTML 5 supports three types of video format:
result: There are three different video formats that can be used with HTML 5.

original: Yes. It is used to add sound or music files on the web page. There are thre
result: Certainly. The <audio> tag is employed to embed sound or music files into a webpage. It has three attributes, which are the controls, source, and type.

original: Let's see the code to play mp3 file using HTML audio tag.
result: Here is an example of how to use HTML audio tag to playback an MP3 file.

original: Instead of koyal.mp3, you can pass any mp3 file name.
result: One can select any name for an mp3 file instead of using the specific name "koyal.mp3".

original: The progress tag is used to represent the progress of the task only while the meter tag is used to measure data within a given range.  More details.
result: The function of the progress tag is to display the advancement of a particular task, whereas the meter tag is predominantly used to measure quantitative data within a set range.

original: The figure tag is used to add a photo in the document on the web page. It is used to handle the group of diagrams, photos, code listing with some embedded content.
result: The figure tag is a useful way to include images in a web page document. It allows for multiple images, such as diagrams, photos, and code listings, to be grouped together with embedded content.

original: The <figcaption> element is used to provide a caption to an image. It is an optional tag and can appear before or after the content within the <figure> tag. The <figcaption> element is used with <figure> element and it can be placed as the first or last child of the <figure> element.
result: The <figcaption> tag is employed to add a caption to an image. It's not mandatory and can be placed before or after the content within <figure> tags. The <figcaption> element is always used in conjunction with <figure> tags and can be positioned as the initial or closing child of <figure> tags.

original: The button tag is used in HTML 5. It is used to create a clickable button within the HTML form on the web page. It is generally used to create a "submit" or "reset" button. Let's see the code to display the button.
result: The button tag is an element used in HTML 5 to create clickable buttons on web pages. These buttons can be used in HTML forms, typically as reset or submit buttons. To display a button, you would write the corresponding code.

original: The details tag is used to specify some additional details on the web page. It can be viewed or hidden on demand. The summary tag is used with details tag.  More details.
result: The purpose of the details tag is to provide extra information about a webpage, which can be displayed or concealed as required. The summary tag is typically used in conjunction with the details tag to offer a summary of the information contained within it.

original: The HTML 5 datalist tag provides an autocomplete feature on the form element. It facilitates users to choose the predefined options to the users to select data.
result: The datalist tag in HTML 5 allows for an autosuggest feature on form fields, making it easier for users to select from a pre-defined list of options.

original: HTML 4 Header and Footer:
result:
Sure, I can rephrase it for you. Here's the new version: 

The header and footer are two elements in HTML 4 that provide structure and help to create a consistent layout for a website. The header is typically located at the top of a webpage and includes the site logo, main navigation menu, and other relevant information. The footer, on the other hand, is found at the bottom of the page and often contains copyright information, contact details, and links to legal pages. By using these elements, designers can create a cohesive and visually appealing website.

original: HTML 5 Header and Footer:
result:
Here is a possible rephrased version: 

The Header and Footer elements are popular features of HTML 5. They allow web developers to easily provide a consistent layout across multiple pages of a website. The Header element typically contains information such as the website's logo, navigation menu, and search bar, while the Footer element often includes copyright information and links to important website sections. These elements can improve the user experience by making it easier to navigate a website and quickly find important information.

original: No, the browser will not be able to identify that it is an HTML document and HTML 5 tags do not function properly..
result: The statement means that if a browser cannot detect that a file is an HTML document, it will not function properly and will not be able to interpret all HTML5 tags. Essentially, the browser needs to be able to identify the file correctly as an HTML document to fully support HTML5 tags.

original: It forces a user to fill text on the text field or text area before submitting the form. It is used for form validation.
result: This feature ensures that the user provides necessary information in the text fields or text areas of a form before submitting it. This is an important aspect of form validation to ensure that all required information is captured.

original: The new input types for form validation are email, URL, number, tel, and date.
result: The latest input types introduced for validating form data are email, URL, number, tel, and date.
